title: Critique on design idea
content:
Hey everyone, I was wondering if you can give your insight on a personal desigh project, it would be greatly appreciated.   
I am currently designing a buiseness card for myself. It includes simple yet elegant type letterpressed on 100 percent cotton card stock. Now the design element I want to incorporate is the use of custom made rubber stamps of some of my "type" specimens and artwork. Since I will make several rubber stamps I'll have a few unique cards I can distribute to clients. I feel this will give the design a feeling of individuality and imagination. And if I ever get tired of a specific image I can just have new rubbrestamps made. What do you think?
author: ivan_melendez

comments.content:
Let multiply the number of the thoughts for four,   
so that their wardens are not enough.   
Best,   
AS

I assume you're printing the cards 8 to a page. If so I suggest you do the rubber stamping before they're trimmed. I know from experience it goes much faster that way.   
George
